data.enText: to turn round and round quickly; to make sth do this

data.chText: 飞机失去控制，不停地旋转。
data.enText: The plane was spinning out of control.
My head is spinning (= I feel as if my head is going around and I can't balance) .

data.chText: 转动球 / 硬币 / 轮子

data.enText: to turn round quickly once; to make sb do this

data.chText: 他猛地回过身来，面对着她。
data.enText: He spun around to face her.
to make thread from wool, cotton, silk, etc. by twisting it
She sat by the window spinning.
to produce thread from its body to make a web or cocoon

data.chText: 他们骑自行车沿公路疾驰。
data.enText: They went spinning along the roads on their bikes.
to remove the water from clothes that have just been washed, in a spin dryer

data.chText: 有倾向性地陈述；（尤指）以有利于自己的口吻描述
data.enText: to present information or a situation in a particular way, especially one that makes you or your ideas seem good

data.chText: 一名助手已经开始将那位参议员的失败描述成“几乎是大获全胜”。
data.enText: An aide was already spinning the senator's defeat as ‘almost as good as an outright win’.

data.chText: 杜撰故事，编造故事（以让人信以为真）
data.enText: to try to make sb believe a long story that is not true
to turn around suddenly so that you are facing in the opposite direction

data.chText: 脱胎（于某事物）；（从某事物）派生，衍生；随之而产生
data.enText: to happen or to produce sth as a new or unexpected result of sth that already exists

data.chText: 从一些畅销书衍生出的产品
data.enText: products spinning off from favourite books

data.chText: 从…脱离出来（组建新公司）
data.enText: to form a new company from parts of an existing one

data.chText: 运输部门将脱离出来组建为一家独立公司。
data.enText: The transportation operation will be spun off into a separate company.
to make sth last as long as possible

data.chText: 把洗过的衣服稍稍甩一下。
data.enText: Give the washing a short spin.
if an aircraft goes into a spin , it falls and turns round rapidly
a short ride in a car for pleasure
the way you make a ball turn very fast when you throw it or hit it

data.chText: 她打出的球旋转得很厉害。
data.enText: She puts a lot of spin on the ball.

data.chText: 投旋转球的板球投球手
data.enText: a spin bowler (= in cricket , a bowler who uses spin)

data.chText: （尤指有利于自己的）导向性陈述
data.enText: a way of presenting information or a situation in a particular way, especially one that makes you or your ideas seem good

data.chText: 政治家们对经济形势各执一词。
data.enText: Politicians put their own spin on the economic situation.

data.chText: 晕头转向；急得团团转；十分激动
她的辞职令同事们摸不着头脑。
data.enText: Her resignation put her colleagues in a spin.

word_means: 急转身，猛转回头，急转弯

ex.chText: 火星是每24小时绕轴线自转一周吗？
ex.enText: Does Mars rotate on its axis once every 24 hours?

ex.chText: 烘烤过程中不要忘记转动托盘。
ex.enText: Don't forget to rotate the pan throughout the baking time.

synonyms.bx: 指物体围绕自己的轴或中心旋转，在特定语境中指自转。

ex.enText: Seagulls circled around above the sea.

ex.chText: 飞机在机场上空盘旋，等待指挥塔的指令。
ex.enText: The plane circled the airport, waiting for the order from the control tower.

ex.chText: 那个轮子为什么不转了？
ex.enText: Why did that wheel stop revolving?

ex.chText: 怎样才能旋转屏幕上的图像？
ex.enText: How can I revolve the image on the screen?

ex.chText: 地球绕太阳公转是常识。
ex.enText: It is common sense that the earth revolves around the sun.

synonyms.bx: 指物体像轮子一样转动，在特定语境中指公转。

ex.chText: 飞机的螺旋桨在快速旋转时，要离得远一些。
ex.enText: Stay away when the plane's propellers are spinning.

ex.chText: 那位做旋转动作的溜冰者吸引了她的注意力。
ex.enText: The spinning ice skater attracted her attention.

synonyms.bx: 强调迅速、连续地旋转，多指绕轴心转动。

ex.chText: 看！海鸥在港口上空盘旋。
ex.enText: Look! The seagulls are whirling over the harbour.

ex.chText: 新郎抱着新娘转了起来。
ex.enText: The groom whirled the bride round in his arms.

synonyms.bx: 强调速度快，含飞旋之意。

data.chText: 杜撰故事，编造故事（以让人信以为真）
data.enText: to try to make sb believe a long story that is not true
to turn around suddenly so that you are facing in the opposite direction

data.chText: 晕头转向；急得团团转；十分激动
她的辞职令同事们摸不着头脑。
data.enText: Her resignation put her colleagues in a spin.

data.chText: 脱胎（于某事物）；（从某事物）派生，衍生；随之而产生
data.enText: to happen or to produce sth as a new or unexpected result of sth that already exists

data.chText: 从一些畅销书衍生出的产品
data.enText: products spinning off from favourite books

data.chText: 从…脱离出来（组建新公司）
data.enText: to form a new company from parts of an existing one

data.chText: 运输部门将脱离出来组建为一家独立公司。
data.enText: The transportation operation will be spun off into a separate company.
to make sth last as long as possible

trans: （从现有公司中）剥离出，独立，分立
（从现有公司中）剥离出，独立，分立
拖长；拉长

tr: a distinctive interpretation (especially as used by politicians to sway public opinion)
example: the campaign put a favorable spin on the story

tr: rapid descent of an aircraft in a steep spiral
a short drive in a car
example: he took the new car for a spin
he gave the crank a spin
it broke off after much twisting

tr: a swift whirling motion (usually of a missile)
twist and turn so as to give an intended interpretation
example: The President's spokesmen had to spin the story to make it less embarrassing

tr: work natural fibers into a thread
form a web by making a thread
revolve quickly and repeatedly around one's own axis
example: The dervishes whirl around and around without getting dizzy
The creek spun its course through the woods

value.def: If something spins or if you spin it, it turns quickly around a central point.

example.ex: The latest discs, used for small portable computers, spin 3600 times a minute...
example.tran: 用在小型便携式计算机上的最新光盘转速为每分钟 3,600 转。

example.ex: The Earth spins on its own axis...
He spun the wheel sharply and made a U turn in the middle of the road...
example.tran: 他猛打方向盘，在路中间掉头。

example.ex: He spun his car round and went after them.
This driving mode allows you to move off in third gear to reduce wheel-spin in icy conditions.
example.tran: 在这个驾驶模式下你可以挂 3 挡起步，以减少轮子在结冰路面上打滑的现象。

value.def: When you spin washing, it is turned round and round quickly in a spin drier or a washing machine to get the water out.

example.ex: Just spin the washing and it's nearly dry.
example.tran: 只需要将洗好的衣物脱水，它就差不多干了。

example.ex: Set on a cool wash and finish with a short spin.
example.tran: 设定用凉水洗衣，最后短时脱水。

value.tran: (用甩干机或洗衣机)甩干（衣服），给…脱水

value.def: If your head is spinning, you feel unsteady or confused, for example because you are drunk, ill, or excited.

example.ex: My head was spinning from the wine...
example.tran: 我喝了葡萄酒后晕乎乎的。

example.ex: All those figures make my poor head spin.
example.tran: 那么多数字把我搞得头昏脑胀。

value.def: If someone puts a certain spin on an event or situation, they interpret it and try to present it in a particular way.

example.ex: He interpreted the vote as support for the constitution and that is the spin his supporters are putting on the results today.
example.tran: 他把这次投票解释为对宪法的支持，这也是他的支持者对今天的投票结果所作的解释。

example.ex: ...the wholly improper political spin given to the report, particularly by The New York Times.
example.tran: 报道中带有的根本不恰当的政治倾向，特别是《纽约时报》的报道

value.tran: 带倾向性的解释(或说法)

value.def: In politics, spin is the way in which political parties try to present everything they do in a positive way to the public and the media.

example.ex: The public is sick of spin and tired of promises. It's time for politicians to act.
example.tran: 公众厌烦了那些有倾向性的报道和种种许诺。该是用政绩说话的时候了。

value.def: If you go for a spin or take a car for a spin, you make a short journey in a car just to enjoy yourself.
If someone spins a story, they give you an account of something that is untrue or only partly true.

example.ex: He was surprised, and annoyed that she had spun a story which was too good to be condemned as a simple lie.
example.tran: 他很惊讶，也很生气，因为她编的故事太真实了，甚至不能被斥为一个简单的谎言。

value.def: When people spin, they make thread by twisting together pieces of a fibre such as wool or cotton using a device or machine.

example.ex: Michelle will also spin a customer's wool fleece to specification at a cost of $2.25 an ounce.
example.tran: 米歇尔也会按顾客的要求为其纺羊毛呢，每盎司收费 2.25 美元。

example.ex: They do their own cooking, spinning, and woodworking.
example.tran: 他们自己做饭，纺线，做木工活。

value.def: If a plane goes into a spin, it falls very rapidly towards the ground in a spiral movement.
value.tran: (飞机的)螺旋式急遽下坠，向下旋冲

value.def: In a game such as tennis or cricket, if you put spin on a ball, you deliberately make it spin rapidly when you hit it or throw it.
value.tran: (网球或板球运动中球的）快速旋转，旋转运动

value.def: If you say that someone is in a spin or in a flat spin, you mean that they are confused and unable to act sensibly because of something that has happened.

example.ex: Poor Jane was in rather a spin about the party.
example.tran: 可怜的简对这次聚会真有些不知所措。

trans: 政界小人物；旋转城市；城市大赢家；旋转都市

自旋波；旋转波；螺旋自旋波；关于自旋波
(政治人物、组织等的)舆论导向专家
空转；车轮空转；旋转滚轮；轮子空转；车轮滑转
项目名称脱水专用电动机；旋转发动机；旋转马达
自旋去耦；自旋去偶；自旋去偶是双共振
自旋共振
不可脱水
旋钮；旋转按钮；微调按钮；纺锤状按钮；中微调控件
航空小英雄；大熊历险记
